journal_entry: The wind N.N.W in morning went a shore on Cranberry isle to take up a note Emma M Spurling held she refused to went on suttons Islands to see her Attorney demanded it of him he refused. Went on board the wind breezed up Southerly got under waay and went out. anchored at Deer Isle
location: Cranberry Isles, Sutton Islands, Deer Isle

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and rainy i the morning work abt the house

journal_entry: The wind Easterly work in the forenoon putting underpin ing under the wing of the house. in the afternoon rainy and snowy wrote letter to Mijsus S.C.Muney &Co Mras Proctur Smallidge

journal_entry: The wind moderate Northerly and warm Hauled up coal from wharf to the House in forenoon. And made Cart Alletree for Haines Bickford in afternoon

journal_entry: The wind East.N.East Snowy all day. wrote letter to American office for Bill poster printed for a douer for Christmas. work on furniture all day. At night rainy

journal_entry: The wind South Snowy and rainy all day worked apart of the forenoon on board of the A.G. Brooks putting a scuttle in the cabin floor. in the afternoon setting up beals

journal_entry: The wind North East. Thermometer 28° overcast.
notes: wind direction entered in am as does not specify time of day, same with weather cond and temperature

journal_entry: The wind N.N.W. the thermometer stood at 23° This day not the particle of snow to the seen and has not been but one or two days sleighmg for the winter The Harbor and coves all free from Ice and the ground as bare as in july. Worked all day for J. D. Harrington. finishing the chamber over his store.. Had for boarders J.D. Harrington Wife and child. and a few Tromcient. ones
